title: I've used this app with great results on all my past devices, but now I have the GS6 that has an octa-core processor, though it's really 2 linked quad cores that perform different tasks, with supposedly only one of the quads ever running at one time.
comment: I figured I'd see how this app interprets the gs6 hardware since it only supports up to 4 cores, and while it only shows 4 cores with the app open, I was surprised to find in the notification pull-down shade it shows 8 real-time % readings. While the readings seem to mirror the cpu process load, I have no idea how accurate it is. I would love to see an update to this app cause it really is well done otherwise.

title: Love it, but has a few issues...
comment: The overall cpu usage numbers (in the notification pull-down) aren't consistent with the readings of the individual cores.  If first core is at 40% and the other 3 are at 0%, overall usage says 40% (you could argue that it is 10% overall.)  But when more than one core is active, the overall number gets *very* strange (I saw 60-something for the first two cores, with an overall of 4%)  Also, overall % is over 100% at times.

title: AWESOME little app other Droid devs TAKE NOTE
comment: Brilliant app obviously written by someone who genuinely knows how to engineer, rather than just throw some bits of code together until something works.  Notification info is concise and at a glance you can tell exactly what all your cores are doing, and what Mhz they are running at. The cubic cores and usage display is inspired. Its so good, you never need to open the app.  I have tried a LOT of CPU monitors. I you run them and check CPU usage most of them are actually the biggest CPU drain on your entire system when monitoring without anything else running. I found a couple that drew so many cycles, my CPU governor never even got a chance to throttle down. The monitor would just suck CPU and keep my quad core at 1-1.6Ghz.  CPU Stats uses around 0.12% of my CPU at all times and takes only 3mb of active RAM!!!  What this means besides the fact your not wasting system resources on monitoring, your monitor is not HUGELY distorting the info it reports.  Other Droid monitoring app devs TAKE NOTE!!! THIS IS HOW TO DO IT!!!  My only feature request of Takke san would be to add CPU temp monitoring. That would make it perfect.  Full suite with battery, Ram, Storage would be the shiz
Good app
